algorithm_technique: Sliding window with prefix sums and parity tracking
problem_summary_simple: Find max freq[a] - freq[b] in a substring of size >= k, where a has odd freq, b has even freq.
problem_summary_technical: Uses prefix sums to calculate character counts and their parity within sliding windows of size k, optimizing difference calculation.
key_insights: The problem requires checking all possible pairs of characters (d^2).
Prefix sums are used to efficiently calculate character counts within any substring.
The sliding window approach, combined with parity tracking (mn[i][j]), optimizes finding the best substring for each character pair.
